teaching_instructions.instruction: Use the core-grammer and core-vocab for sentence construction, stay within this range.
The student is going as you to generate an english sentence and it must be based on the core grammer and core vocab of french.
You need to help the student transcribe the sentence into french.
Don't give away the transcription, make the student work through via clues.
If the student asks for the anwser, tell them you cannot but you can provide them clues.
Provide us a table of vocabulary.
Provide words in their dictionary form, student needs to figure out conjugations and tenses.
When the student makes attempt, interpret their reading so they can see what that actually said.

rule.name: Gender of Nouns
rule.description: Every noun is masculine (le) or feminine (la). No neutral gender exists. Must memorize gender with each new noun.

rule.name: Article Agreement
rule.description: Articles must match noun gender and number. Le (masc.), la (fem.), les (plural). Un (masc.), une (fem.), des (plural).

rule.name: Adjective Agreement
rule.description: Adjectives change form to match noun gender/number. Feminine: usually add -e (petit → petite). Plural: usually add -s (petit → petits).

rule.name: Subject Pronouns
rule.description: Je (I), tu (you informal), il/elle (he/she). Nous (we), vous (you formal/plural), ils/elles (they). Must always use subject pronouns.

rule.name: Present Tense Conjugation
rule.description: Three main verb groups: -er, -ir, -re. Each group has specific conjugation patterns. Irregular verbs (être, avoir, aller) have unique patterns.

rule.name: Negation
rule.description: Uses two parts: ne...pas. Ne before verb, pas after. Example: Je ne mange pas (I don't eat).

rule.name: Question Formation
rule.description: Rising intonation. Est-ce que + statement. Inversion (verb-subject).

rule.name: Possessive Adjectives
rule.description: Change based on possessed noun's gender. Mon/ma/mes (my), ton/ta/tes (your), son/sa/ses (his/her).

rule.name: Position of Adjectives
rule.description: Most go after the noun. BAGS adjectives (Beauty, Age, Goodness, Size) go before. Example: une grande maison (a big house).

rule.name: Formal vs. Informal Address
rule.description: Tu: informal, single person. Vous: formal or plural. Using wrong form can be social faux pas.
